name: Tikduck Flying Orb Ball 2024 Toys Soaring Hover Boomerang Spinner Hand Controlled Mini Drone Cosmic Globe Spinning Kids Adults Outdoor Birthday Gift Cool Stuff for Boys Girls 6 7 8 9 10+ Year Old
about_this_item: Super Cool High-Tech Hand Controlled Drone : Our flying orb ball featuring a gyroscope and smart AI chip that promises intelligent flight. Different throwing angles and speeds will create different flight lines and boomerang effect. This cool stuff not only brings fun to play but also helps to improve children's hands-on ability, operating skills, intelligence, and creativity.

Lightweight Body: This flying ball drone toy is made of high-grade ABS material, which is lightweight and flexible, making it able to withstand countless crashes. The propellers are safely concealed within the ball drone. The enclosed propellers cause no worry that children will be hurt by their blades.

USB Rechargeable: Simply connect it to the USB connector for 25 minutes to fully charge. (Flying time: 8 to 10 minutes, Battery life varies individually due to environmental factors). When the LED indicator flashes, it means that the aircraft needs to charged. The indicator light remains lit when charging, and turns off when charging is complete.

For Anytime, Anywhere Fun: You don’t need a lot of space to take off with our hand operated drone. It is fun and easy to control anywhere. It’s designed to work indoors as well as outdoors, with a smooth flight pattern and boomerang effect. It’s the perfect backyard activity, but can easily be used indoors as well. This flying ball is a great conversation piece for family, school, and holiday gatherings. It’s a simple way to teach about physics and aerodynamics, even from a young age.

Perfect Gift: This hand-controlled drone is a fun novelty gift for birthdays, Halloween, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas. This is a great choice for Easter, Father's Day, Mother's Day gift toys. It’s a perfect enrichment gift for kids, teenagers, adults, and the elderly.

title: Very fun encaptivating toy for kids 5+
content: It actually works if you toss it in the air flat it will go up and float down right back in your hands. If you tilt it forward about 20 degrees you can toss or underhand it and it will float forward and come back. Takes some practice for sure. The leds are a huge plus because you can even play at night. Battery lasts reasonably long time similar to a drone helicopter toy however it does take some time to charge. The toy does feel sort of brittle so only thing Im worried about but it does turn off when it falls to the floor. That is actually how you turn it on by shaking it as well.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: My son bought this item after seeing a few videos of it being thrown and floating back . ( boomerang) action. It can be a fun toy to play with, playing catch with my so  or a friend is more fun than by yourself. It does have a crazy powerful motor and fan . When you start it by giving a flick with the ball in your hand activates the motor to start. When you hold the ball level you can feel how it pulls with the fan . If you angle the top half toward you , you can feel it wants to fly toward you with it at the same angle push you hand forward and let go it should want to fly back into your hand. After a few practice throws you can sense where the ball wants to go . This will allow you to preform the boomerang action of the ball. Or you can use the force the fan blades are pushing an angle the top toward a friend or in my case my son . And you can play catch back an forth. Lights are colorful. The on off button ia on the top of the motor if you have larger finger you will need something to push the button with something. My fingers are to larger to fit through the top of the ball to turn on and off. Charger is also at the top of the motor. I would warn anyone with long hair be careful. Loose hair might get caught in open fan blade . I was nervous with my wife and daughter playing toss with us . Thankfully no accidents but I questioned the open fan design and how we were playing with it.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: I bought this for my 7 year old grandson that is usually on the sidelines.. handsome, shy, loves soccer but in a group of kids, he holds back.. I thereafter ordered 4 more so they could extend their interactive play,developing skill  in hand eye coordination , balance & quickness.... this bouncing ball  put bounce & enthusiasm back into my grandson’s. title: Grandsons Loved it!
content: Lightweight and Durable, this light up ball kept our 12 and 9 year old grandsons amused and entertained longer than I expected. They had so much fun watching it float quickly through the air and enjoyed finding different ways to make it go places. The ball goes pretty fast and will go really far so if you’re near a body of water like we were on a walk we took, you might lose it. His landed in about two feet of clear cold water in a meandering stream that had plenty of rocks to be able to gain access to it, but after at least 10 minutes in the water, I didn’t think it would still work. It is a truly durable electronic ball! It still worked fine! The battery runs down in about 20 minutes of constant playing, but they love it and I would definitely buy it again!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023

title: Over priced! Wow.
content: I gave this to my 12-year-old son (Jeff) and at first, he loved it. Now he is staying far away from it. Whenever I tell him to play with it he says "Mom it keeps trying to kill me!". Each time I tell him it's nonsense and to go play with it. Well, today I went to his room and it turned on by itself. It then beat me to the ground then flew out the window. I called the police and now it's the FBI most wanted after blowing up a police car.

title: Battery don't last long
content: If you're ordering for kids for Christmas, we suggest that you watch videos & read how to "play" with these before Christmas morning. They need to be charged & definitely need to know how they operate. They can be FRAGILE. You'll possibly avoid some disappointed kids while they're charging & you're trying to figure out how to make them work. If course, it depends on the age of your kids. Ours are 6 & 8. Teenagers will probably take off with them. However, they still need to be charged up. They'll keep 'em out of your hair Christmas morning! Just watch for colorful, whizzing, sparkling orbs flying thru the air!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
